result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario M. Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office. Defendant to establish payment plan within 60 days (11/20/15).
Defendant to continue his current counseling.  Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario M. Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on July 26, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

15CT291, 15CT258 & 15CM318 Defendant, Karen Sue Doyle in court, Defendant Juan Rosales Flores, Mario M. Martinez; James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State heard - recomm. DPA for Doyle and Rosales Flores; State heard on recomm. for Martinez - victim rights coplied with; Court reviews right to counsel for all 3; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Def. Martinez has taken Methadone today; all F&V waive counsel; Court reviews charge/penalties for each Def.; Def. Doyle pleads NC to OAR; Def. Rosales Flores pleads NC to Operate w/o Valid DL3rd; Def. Martinez pleads Guilty to Retail Theft; Def. Doyle heard on facts; State heard on same; Court accepts waiver of counsel and pleas in all cases, defers finding of guilt in Doyle 15CT291 and approves DPA; bond cont; in Rosales Flores in 15CT258, Court accepts waiver and plea, defers finding of guilt and approves DPA, bond cont.  In 15CM318 Martinez, Court accepts waiver and plea and finds Def. guilty of Retail Theft; State heard; Court imposes sentence

Martinez 15CM318: Retail Theft
** W/H - 1 year PO
* $243 CC
* $200 DNA surchrge
* cont. counseling

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Shopko, Beaver Dam WI.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:30 - Defendant, Mario M. Martinez in court, Intern Kevin Schmidt w/ADA James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Shopko, Beaver Dam WI.  Return date scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
